result.execSummary:
The defendant Whitney R Roberson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*  provide a DNA sample
*   pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges while on probation to convert to a civil judgment
*   Obtain and maintain full time employment.

*   no new citations for retail theft
*   no new violations of the law.

timeConds.notes: * 15 days condition time with Huber for work and child care with a report date of 8/1/2016.  Court allows for house arrest thru electronic monitoring only if the defendant has paid in full all costs, fees and assessments and DNA surcharges by the report in date of 8/1/2016

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Whitney R Roberson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Authorizing Electronic Monitoring, signed and filed.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Court withheld sentence and  placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
      * 15 days condition time with Huber for work and child care with a report date of 8/1/2016.  Court allows for house arrest thru electronic monitoring only if the defendant has paid in full all costs, fees and assessments and DNA surcharges by the report in date of 8/1/2016
      *  provide a DNA sample
     *   pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges while on probation to convert to a civil judgment
     *   no new citations for retail theft
     *   no new violations of the law.
     *   Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Sentencing Referral Form,  received and filed.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant making restitution.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Scheduling Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Nordstrom Rack.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Whitney R Roberson in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-29-2015 at 01:30pm
